jobDescription: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. Position Summary This position reports to the Data Analytics Manager in the CIP Fair Lending Data Analytics Team. We are seeking a qualified, creative, self-motivated candidate with excellent analytical and quantitative skills to contribute to the growth of the CIP Fair Lending Testing Program. Essential Job Functions 1. Perform fair lending statistical analysis for various lending products with minimal or no supervision.  2. Analyze lending policies and processes for various products to design a fair lending test and provide specification.  3. Generate thorough reports with the results of fair lending analyses, and present the report to senior management.  4. Act as a lead analyst for specific projects, this includes managing the various aspect of a fair lending test including: planning, data acquisition, project schedule, and actively engaging with subject matter experts and business leaders to gain insight on policies and processes affecting the decisions on the products being studied.  5. Perform matched pair analyses and produce file samples for manual fair lending review.  6. Planning and execution of complex studies.  7. Perform various complex ad-hoc analyses.  *LI-NR1 Required Experience · A minimum of 7 years prior experience in banking or a financial institution in an analytical role.  · A minimum of 6 performing fair lending statistical analysis.  · A minimum 7 years of experience using SAS in a banking or financial institution. SAS certifications a plus.  · Experience performing statistical data analyses for credit risk, or finance in banking, a financial institution or related organization a plus.  · Experience and broad knowledge of project management  · Experience with spatial analysis a plus  · Experience developing maps with SAS/Graph a plus.  · Requires deep knowledge of job area.
